headline: Week’s Best: UBS on Its Way to Adding More Banking Services
summary: UBS   received conditional approval from a U.S. banking regulator for a national bank charter, positioning the company to expand its banking and lending services for wealth management clients in the U.S. The Swiss bank applied for a charter last year.  A national charter is a “game changer” for UBS, says Robert Karofsky, co-president of global wealth management and president of UBS Americas.  Raymond James Financial  has reached an agreement to acquire Clark Capital Management, a Philadelphia-based asset manager that oversees $46 billion in investments.

headline: RJF to Buy Clark Capital to Strengthen Asset Management Business
summary: Raymond James agrees to acquire Clark Capital, adding a $46B boutique manager to expand its asset management platform and advisor-focused investment solutions.

headline: A Look At BankUnited (BKU) Valuation After Positive Raymond James Coverage And Fresh 52 Week High
summary: BankUnited (BKU) drew fresh attention after Raymond James launched coverage with a positive rating. The move coincided with a 3.1% intraday gain and a new 52 week high that highlighted shifting sentiment around the regional lender. See our latest analysis for BankUnited. The upbeat call from Raymond James comes on top of a 90 day share price return of 28.87% and a 1 year total shareholder return of 22.60%, suggesting momentum has been building as sentiment toward BankUnited improves. headline: Stock Markets Can Learn From Trump’s Iran Pause. Why It’s Key for Investors.
summary: Taiwan companies offer U.S. chip investment for lower tariffs, Goldman sees possible opportunities in prediction markets, Verizon offering $20 credits after resolving service outage, and more news to start your day.
